  1. A Proud City with Unlimited Potential

  1. Latest News Articles
  2. Community Events

  1. Latest News Articles

  1. Schools Projected Enrollment - Weldon Cooper Report

    The city requested a school enrollment projection study from Weldon Cooper Center. A comparison was prepared using the data. Read on...

  2. FY 2020 Recommended Budget

    We encourage you to attend a council work session or regular meeting on the FY 2020 budget. Next meetings are on April 16. Read on...

  3. City Saves $1.8 Million by Reducing Energy Use in Buildings

    The City saved $1,802,805 dollars and 25,590,190 lbs less greenhouse gases by reducing electricity and fossil fuel consumption in city buildings. Read on...

  4. Canal Spring Cleanup Undertaken

    In honor of the first day of spring, twenty-five city staff members from eight different city departments joined together to clean the canal. Read on...

  5. City Employee Values

    We are excited to announce our new employee Core Values. Our vision is "One Team for a Great Community." Read on...

  6. Welcome to Our New City Website

    Welcome to our new website! We hope you like the changes you see. This site is best viewed in the browser Chrome. Read on...

  7. Utility Bill Changes for Garbage Services

    There is an update occurring on how we will bill for garbage services, we will now charge for the current period.

  8. Fredericksburg Baseball Celebrates Groundbreaking

    On February 24, Fredericksburg Baseball along with more than 1,000 fans held a ceremonial groundbreaking for the multi-purpose stadium, which is scheduled to open in April 2020. Read on...
View All News

/Calendar.aspx

  1. Explore Our New City Website

    Welcome to our new website! We hope you like the changes you see. Please note that if you bookmarked pages on our old website, you may find that the link needs to be updated to the new page location, and the site is best viewed with Google Chrome. We encourage everyone to watch our short video and then to take a scroll around our new website. If you need any assistance, please feel free to contact us at webstaff@fredericksburgva.gov.
  1. Community Highlights
    Check out the latest highlights in Fredericksburg!

  1. Farmers Market Opens April 20th

    The Fredericksburg Farmers Market is an open-air market where home-grown, homemade, or hand-baked goods are sold by farmers and bakers from our area. Read on...

  2. Name the Baseball Team Contest

    The Potomac Nationals have announced a "name-the-team-contest" in preparation for their new baseball stadium being built in Fredericksburg Read on...

  3. Chatham Bridge Repair

    The Virginia Department of Transportation is advancing the Chatham Bridge Rehabilitation Project to start construction sooner than originally scheduled. Read on...

  4. Residents Guide

    Are you a city resident? Are you new to the area? No matter which category you fall into, there's something for you in the Residents Guide. Read on...

  5. Stay Connected!

    Stay up to date on the latest news and local events by signing up for email or text notifications through Notify Me®. Read on...

  6. Civic Involvement

    The seven-member legislative body known as the City Council is composed of a mayor and six council members. Get involved in the decisions that are being made in your community by attending a City Council meeting. Read on...
